New Records: Kyle Schwarber tied Alfonso Soriano for the MLB record for most leadoff home runs in a season (13)
Key Match Events: Philadelphia Phillies won four consecutive games with Kyle Schwarber hitting five home runs, two leadoff
Pre-Game Insights: The Philadelphia Phillies were on a cold stretch before their recent hot streak, which has them back to winning games in long stretches
Post-Match Reflections: The team is back to winning games in long stretches and Kyle Schwarber is finally looking like the same slugger the organization has come to love
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kyle Schwarber's recent hot streak has given him a real chance at making MLB history
The 31-year-old has made up some major ground over his recent hot stretch
The Phillies have held the division lead since the first week of May
Others: The team had recently undergone a serious cold stretch that had people starting to doubt them as postseason contenders
Kyle Schwarber's overall OPS is still higher than in his previous seasons
